title: Traffic Congestion Prediction using Big Data
description: Built a big data pipeline to process 94.5M+ rows of NYC DOT Traffic Speeds data using Apache Spark on Google Cloud Dataproc. Integrated ELK stack for monitoring and visualization.
longDescription: This project focused on leveraging big data technologies to handle massive traffic datasets from NYC DOT. Using Apache Spark on Google Cloud Dataproc, the system efficiently processed 94.5 million+ rows of traffic speed data to detect congestion trends. The ELK stack was integrated for monitoring pipelines and visualizing insights in real time.
problem: Traffic congestion in large cities leads to lost productivity and environmental impact. Traditional systems often fail to process large-scale traffic datasets efficiently.
solution: Designed a scalable pipeline with Apache Spark on GCP, enabling distributed data processing. Integrated Elasticsearch, Logstash, and Kibana (ELK) for visualization and system monitoring.
results: Processed 94.5M+ rows in under 10 minutes. Achieved accurate congestion trend detection and provided real-time dashboards for city planning use cases.

title: Semantic Book Recommender – Hugging Face Deployment
description: Developed an intelligent book recommendation system using Python, LangChain, and Hugging Face Transformers. Implemented vector search with OpenAI embeddings for semantic similarity.
longDescription: This project built a semantic recommendation engine for books. Instead of keyword matching, the system uses embeddings to capture semantic meaning, allowing users to get book suggestions based on content similarity.
problem: Traditional recommendation systems rely on collaborative filtering or keyword searches, which fail to capture deeper semantic relationships.
solution: Leveraged Hugging Face Transformers and OpenAI embeddings with LangChain for semantic similarity. Vector search was implemented using FAISS for efficient retrieval.
results: Delivered highly accurate book recommendations by meaning rather than keywords. Successfully deployed on Hugging Face Spaces with interactive search.

title: Leafio – Plant Disease Detection
description: Created an Android app powered by a CNN model for real-time plant disease detection. Integrated a Flask API backend to serve predictions with 85%+ accuracy.
longDescription: Leafio was designed as a mobile solution for farmers to quickly detect crop diseases using their smartphones. A custom CNN was trained on thousands of plant leaf images, integrated into a Flask backend, and connected to an Android app frontend.
problem: Farmers often lack quick, reliable methods to identify crop diseases, leading to reduced yields.
solution: Developed a CNN model with >85% accuracy. Served predictions via Flask API and built an Android frontend for real-time camera-based detection.
results: Achieved >85% prediction accuracy and reduced disease identification time from days to seconds, improving farming efficiency.

title: Face-it – Facial Recognition App
description: Developed a full-stack facial recognition application using Clarifai’s pre-trained model. Designed a secure and responsive UI for user interaction and real-time detection.
longDescription: Face-it is a full-stack application that integrates Clarifai's pre-trained model for facial recognition. The project includes a user-friendly interface with secure login and responsive design, providing real-time face detection and recognition.
problem: Building robust face recognition solutions typically requires expensive training and complex infrastructure.
solution: Used Clarifai’s pre-trained model for facial recognition, combined with a secure React frontend and backend integration.
results: Delivered a fast, lightweight, and accessible face recognition app for web-based real-time detection.

title: Attrition Prediction Dashboard
description: Built a machine learning pipeline to analyze HR attrition data. Implemented preprocessing, model training, and visual dashboards to highlight key employee risk factors.
longDescription: The Attrition Prediction Dashboard is a data-driven HR analytics tool. It identifies which employees are at high risk of leaving, helping organizations improve retention strategies.
problem: High employee turnover increases hiring costs and disrupts productivity. HR teams often lack predictive tools for early intervention.
solution: Built preprocessing pipelines with Pandas, trained ML models to predict attrition, and developed interactive dashboards for visualization.
results: Improved HR decision-making with predictive insights and interactive dashboards showing high-risk employees and factors.

title: RAG Resume Agent
description: Implemented a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipeline using LangChain, FAISS, and OpenAI to create an interactive resume assistant capable of answering recruiter-style queries.
longDescription: RAG Resume Agent is an AI-powered application that allows recruiters to query resumes conversationally. It uses a RAG pipeline with FAISS for vector search and OpenAI for generation, implemented through LangChain.
problem: Recruiters spend significant time scanning resumes manually, making hiring inefficient.
solution: Implemented a retrieval-augmented generation system that indexes resumes using FAISS and answers recruiter-style questions with LLMs.
results: Reduced recruiter resume screening time by enabling direct Q&A over resumes. Demonstrated a real-world application of RAG in HR tech.
